intro: Streptocarpus ovatus, commonly known as the oval streptocarpus, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or well-drained soil, thriving in bright, indirect light. Its flowers are usually violet or blue in color and bloom during the cooler months. Streptocarpus ovatus is often cultivated as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and ease of care.
